        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        Thanks for the report. I'm unable to reproduce this inside of Linux, and frankly the PoC is too big for me to feel comfortable running it under non-sandboxed Windows. Would you mind trying to minimize that poc a bit?<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I'm unable to reproduce this inside of Linux, and frankly the PoC is too big for me to feel comfortable running it under non-sandboxed Windows. Would you mind trying to minimize that poc a bit?<!----></span><br><br>Tentatively setting OS=Win and impact=None because I don't *think* Vulkan is enabled for any Windows users at this moment.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively setting OS=Win and impact=None because I don't *think* Vulkan is enabled for any Windows users at this moment.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<span class="line"><!---->First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<!----></span><br><br>> Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<!----></span><br><br>Additionally, the driver is quite old:<span class="line"><!---->Additionally, the driver is quite old:<!----></span><br><br>> Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<!----></span><br><br>Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<span class="line"><!---->Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<!----></span><br><br>Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<span class="line"><!---->Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }

          flex-shrink: 0;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

            min-height: 0;

          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1432831: Security: heap-use-after-free libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\ContextVk.cpp:7932 in rx::ContextVk::onResourceAccess
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1432831: Security: heap-use-after-free libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\ContextVk.cpp:7932 in rx::ContextVk::onResourceAccess
          </h1>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1432831#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Apr 18, 2023, 12:14 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1432831#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Apr 18, 2023, 12:14 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<span class="line"><!---->First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<!----></span><br><br>> Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<!----></span><br><br>Additionally, the driver is quite old:<span class="line"><!---->Additionally, the driver is quite old:<!----></span><br><br>> Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<!----></span><br><br>Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<span class="line"><!---->Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<!----></span><br><br>Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<span class="line"><!---->Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }

          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;

          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;

          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;

          cursor: pointer;

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;

          }

          }

        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<span class="line"><!---->First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<!----></span><br><br>> Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<!----></span><br><br>Additionally, the driver is quite old:<span class="line"><!---->Additionally, the driver is quite old:<!----></span><br><br>> Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<!----></span><br><br>Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<span class="line"><!---->Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<!----></span><br><br>Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<span class="line"><!---->Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1432831: Security: heap-use-after-free libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\ContextVk.cpp:7932 in rx::ContextVk::onResourceAccess
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      m.coo...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3239484529" title="m.coo...@gmail.com"><!---->m.coo...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      m.coo...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->m.coo...@gmail.com<!----></span>

        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1432831: Security: heap-use-after-free libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\ContextVk.cpp:7932 in rx::ContextVk::onResourceAccess
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>

        First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<span class="line"><!---->First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<!----></span><br><br>> Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<!----></span><br><br>Additionally, the driver is quite old:<span class="line"><!---->Additionally, the driver is quite old:<!----></span><br><br>> Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<!----></span><br><br>Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<span class="line"><!---->Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<!----></span><br><br>Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<span class="line"><!---->Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report. I'm unable to reproduce this inside of Linux, and frankly the PoC is too big for me to feel comfortable running it under non-sandboxed Windows. Would you mind trying to minimize that poc a bit?<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I'm unable to reproduce this inside of Linux, and frankly the PoC is too big for me to feel comfortable running it under non-sandboxed Windows. Would you mind trying to minimize that poc a bit?<!----></span><br><br>Tentatively setting OS=Win and impact=None because I don't *think* Vulkan is enabled for any Windows users at this moment.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively setting OS=Win and impact=None because I don't *think* Vulkan is enabled for any Windows users at this moment.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<span class="line"><!---->First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<!----></span><br><br>> Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<!----></span><br><br>Additionally, the driver is quite old:<span class="line"><!---->Additionally, the driver is quite old:<!----></span><br><br>> Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<!----></span><br><br>Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<span class="line"><!---->Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<!----></span><br><br>Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<span class="line"><!---->Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report. I'm unable to reproduce this inside of Linux, and frankly the PoC is too big for me to feel comfortable running it under non-sandboxed Windows. Would you mind trying to minimize that poc a bit?<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I'm unable to reproduce this inside of Linux, and frankly the PoC is too big for me to feel comfortable running it under non-sandboxed Windows. Would you mind trying to minimize that poc a bit?<!----></span><br><br>Tentatively setting OS=Win and impact=None because I don't *think* Vulkan is enabled for any Windows users at this moment.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively setting OS=Win and impact=None because I don't *think* Vulkan is enabled for any Windows users at this moment.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<span class="line"><!---->First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<!----></span><br><br>> Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<!----></span><br><br>Additionally, the driver is quite old:<span class="line"><!---->Additionally, the driver is quite old:<!----></span><br><br>> Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<!----></span><br><br>Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<span class="line"><!---->Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<!----></span><br><br>Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<span class="line"><!---->Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report. I'm unable to reproduce this inside of Linux, and frankly the PoC is too big for me to feel comfortable running it under non-sandboxed Windows. Would you mind trying to minimize that poc a bit?<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. I'm unable to reproduce this inside of Linux, and frankly the PoC is too big for me to feel comfortable running it under non-sandboxed Windows. Would you mind trying to minimize that poc a bit?<!----></span><br><br>Tentatively setting OS=Win and impact=None because I don't *think* Vulkan is enabled for any Windows users at this moment.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively setting OS=Win and impact=None because I don't *think* Vulkan is enabled for any Windows users at this moment.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<span class="line"><!---->First of all,  it looks like the tests are causing the driver to crash, the logs have this right before the message:<!----></span><br><br>> Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Error: 0x00000502, in ..\..\third_party\angle\src\libANGLE\renderer\vulkan\CommandProcessor.cpp, queueSubmit:1448. Internal Vulkan error (-4): The logical or physical device has been lost.<!----></span><br><br>Additionally, the driver is quite old:<span class="line"><!---->Additionally, the driver is quite old:<!----></span><br><br>> Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Vulkan 1.2.175 (NVIDIA NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650 Ti (0x000011C6)), NVIDIA-472.12.0.0<!----></span><br><br>Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<span class="line"><!---->Given that this doesn't reproduce anywhere else, it's clearly triggering a driver bug in that Nvidia driver version. There is no plan to enable Vulkan on Nvidia/Windows, let alone on old buggy drivers.<!----></span><br><br>Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<span class="line"><!---->Going to Won't Fix this, there's nothing for us to do here.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;

            <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized" disabled="">
              Convert issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </form>
      </chops-dialog>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
